synaptree.config.title: SynapTree Settings
synaptree.config.colors.directory: Color for directory nodes. Distinguishes folders from files.
synaptree.config.colors.root: Color for the root node. The starting point of your workspace.
synaptree.config.colors.defaultFile: Default color for file nodes. Used when no specific extension color is defined.
synaptree.config.colors.extensions: Custom colors by file extension. Useful for highlighting specific languages or assets (e.g. .ts, .js).
synaptree.config.visuals.activeColor: Highlight color for links when a connected node is hovered or selected.
synaptree.config.visuals.normalOpacity: Base opacity of links (0.0 - 1.0). Lower values create a subtle look; higher values emphasize structure.
synaptree.config.visuals.particleSpeed: Speed of the signal particles flowing along the links.
synaptree.config.visuals.particleWidth: Size of the signal particles. Increase for more visible activity.
synaptree.config.general.language: Display language. Set to 'auto' to match VS Code's language.
synaptree.config.general.ignorePatterns: Glob patterns to exclude. Excluding folders like 'node_modules' significantly improves performance.
synaptree.config.general.autoFocus: Auto-Focus active file. If enabled, the camera automatically moves to the node of the file you open in the editor.
